Author: John Heldnik#0767
Content: Thanks. I will try a bit

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: But I think hyperdex has an auto utxo splitter?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think for reliability its best to have a "trading" address with a spread of UTXO's then trades just always work. thats how I have always done it for a long time, and rarely have faliures.

Author: 7rank#9952
Content: @blackjok3r can you elaborate?  How did you set up the spread that works most of the time?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Just have lots of them. I always yuse the same address then sent a heap of 10 KMD to it... over time the transactions cause change UTXO's to fill up the wallet... occasionally they get a bit small, sou you need to withdraw some KMD back to your own address to consolidate some of them. This way there is always lots of dust UTXO to use for the Alice Dex fee aswell. No nede to worry about splitting UTXO's and all that stuff.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: BarterDEX has the UTXO inventory, which is good to use to split one deposit in one transaction to save on transaction fees and time.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Once you have it set up, it works for quite some time.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its not like I buy 100's of KMD volume of anything though.

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: You can also use barterdex inventory maker

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Login on barter, make inventory, login on hyper with the same address to do the trades

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: send you KMD to trading address, make inventory... 10-50 UTXO 10-20 KMD in size and a few 0.1 to start with is pretty good.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you should get matched on any trade that way, proveded the bob is working.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Another thing I notice with Hyper, ALWAYS increase the price it chooses by 5%.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: or at least 2%

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it gets `unmatched` a LOT on smaller amounts.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: most of the time, on the bob console it was refusing a trade with HyperDEX buys, by margins of less than 0.001c

Author: 7rank#9952
Content: @Cryptoon @blackjok3r thanks for your input, guys.  I'll try this from now on.  For some reason I though hyperDEX removed the utxo hurdle from users.  However, after many unmatched trades it would explain why I'm having issues.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It does not `join` UTXO together... it can only trade up to the larges UTXO you have, and doesnt really tell you this.

Author: 7rank#9952
Content: @Cryptoon for larger trades, do you recommend the 2 transactions funding approach?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: unmatched doesn't necessarily mean you did anything wrong either... I was trying to buy GAME earlier, 2nd trade for 3 GAME was matched,  but only bought 0.9 adn then after than couldnt get a single trade through.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Most bobs dont have large UTXO's for sale. so buy/sellign large amounts you usually need to do heaps of smaller trades.

Author: 7rank#9952
Content: @blackjok3r I understand. Thx

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: When I get a hit, I try the same amounts, if it's unmatched, it usually means the UTXO's of the sellers aren't matching yours so you can try different size orders/utxo's

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: HyperDEX has a bunch of coins activated by default. I am not 100% sure how you remove an unmatched swap. Unmatched means it did not match and timed out. The DEX can only make trades while you are online, if you ave gone offline, (closed the app for any reason) that trade is dead.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If it was unmatched it never found a seller and nothing happened.

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: could be an issue with the underlying `marketmaker` daemon locking up your UTXOs which is out of the control of HyperDEX (we just build the GUI)

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: you could try downloading HyperDEX Nightly

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: import your seed into that

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: then withdraw your funds

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: they are totally isolated instances

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: won't fix the bug, but will enable you to withdraw your funds

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: you should avoid running both HyperDEX and HyperDEX Nightly at the same time too

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: https://github.com/atomiclabs/hyperdex-nightlies

Author: sindresorhus#8187
Content:
New HyperDEX alpha version is out: ERC20 support and the ability to export your trade history to CSV (for Excel).
https://github.com/atomiclabs/hyperdex/releases/latest

Important: If you have used any previous beta version, you need to delete your trade history as this version has an incompatible format. Right after opening this version, go to the "Debug" menu and choose "Delete Trade History".
